meanings.definition: A person who shines shoes for a living.
meanings.sent1: The shoeblacks on the street always make my shoes sparkle.
meanings.sent2: I saw a group of shoeblacks outside the train station.
meanings.sent3: The shoeblacks had a competition to see who could shine shoes the fastest.
meanings.sent4: The shoeblacks' dedication to their craft is truly admirable.
meanings.sent5: The shoeblacks' hands moved swiftly, transforming dull shoes into glossy works of art.

meanings.sent1: I learned the art of shoeblacks from my grandfather.
meanings.sent2: The shoeblacks at the airport work efficiently to keep travelers' shoes clean.
meanings.sent3: The shoeblacks' union organized a shoe shining marathon.
meanings.sent4: His shoeblacks were so thorough that the shoes looked brand new.
meanings.sent5: The shoeblacks' skill was evident in the mirror-like shine they achieved.

meanings.definition: The equipment or materials used for shining shoes.
meanings.sent1: The shoeblacks' kit contained brushes, polish, and cloths.
meanings.sent2: I bought a new set of shoeblacks for my shoe shining business.
meanings.sent3: The shoeblacks' supplies were neatly organized in a wooden box.
meanings.sent4: The shoeblacks' tools gleamed under the bright lights of the shoe shine stand.
meanings.sent5: The shoeblacks' equipment was essential for their trade.
